pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.2: “Tonics” renders _bhesajja_. In the origin story below _bhesajja_ seems to refer to the five standard tonics, and I translate it accordingly. The commentary at Sp 2.306 glosses _bhesajja_ with _sappitelādīsu_,  “Ghee, oil, etc.”, which lends some  support to this view. In the actual rule, however, the word _paccaya_ is used, which suggests a broader meaning. See comment to the actual rule below.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.7: According ACMC, p.18, one _doṇa_ is equivalent to 64 handfuls. This is perhaps roughly equivalent to one liter.
